title: 820-00165 Stuck on Apple logo
message: So I have o nthe bench an 820-00165 that the customer said he took to another shop and they said there is a problem with the power distribution on the LB. I was like what?! never heard that before. I checked it out and asked for history and he said his daughter was using it and it just stopped working. I powerd it on and the BL is not working but is will boot to Apple logo but gets stuck on an empty progress bar. I took the board out and U7701 definitely suffered liquid damage as well as the resistors to the right of it. U3210 has a tiny bit of dried stuff above it. My question is, neither one of these could cause the LB not to load the OS correct? I looked the whole board under MS and do not see liquid on the PCH side or by U6100.

title: 820-00165 Stuck on Apple logo
message:
Liquid spill can affect BIOS sometime.
Try known good working BIOS as first step; clean ME, of course.

title: 820-00165 Stuck on Apple logo
message: Liquid spill can affect the BIOS even if it didn't get liquid on it? Can you explain?
